{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents describe median rhomboid glossitis as a condition characterized by lesions on the tongue. Median rhomboid glossitis is described as an infection caused by Candida Albicans in one document, and a localized chronic fungal infection in another. This suggests that the underlying cause of median rhomboid glossitis is not developmental or related to papillae, but rather an inflammatory response to a fungus.
